benchmark_details.name: EX-FEVER: A Dataset for Multi-hop Explainable Fact Verification
benchmark_details.overview: EX-FEVER is a pioneering dataset for multi-hop explainable fact verification, comprising over 60,000 claims requiring 2-hop and 3-hop reasoning, each with a veracity label and an accompanying explanation.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a high-quality dataset for improving explainability in multi-hop fact verification.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Evaluating the effectiveness of the system remains challenging, as the Rouge score may inadequately assess explanation quality.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the comparison between predicted labels and ground truth.
methodology.interpretation: A higher F1 Score indicates better model performance in generating correct predictions.
methodology.baseline_results: Accuracy benchmark results show a significant performance gap between BERT and GEAR models.
methodology.validation: Dataset is split into training, validation, and test sets with a 70%-20%-10% split.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Demographic factors are not explicitly analyzed in the dataset.
